s.text: The NYT and WP quote State sources claiming that even if Bushnell's request had been honored, the completion of a new embassy would have taken years, and hence the U.S. would have still occupied the old one at the time of the bombing.

None of the reporting mentions it, but this sort of development is sadly familiar--it was reported after the fact that the Marines' commanding officer in Beirut in 1983 had expressed grave concern to his superiors about the vulnerability of his troops to hostile forces operating in the area.

None of the reporting mentions it, but this sort of development is sadly familiar--it was reported after the fact that the Marines' commanding officer in Beirut in 1983 had expressed grave concern to his superiors about the vulnerability of his troops to hostile forces operating in the area.
The LAT has a front-page story confirming that the woman in the Kenya rubble known to rescuers only as "Rose" (full name: Rose Wanjiku Mwangi) was found dead on Wednesday.
The NYT adds that the U.S. military command covering the region also expressed concern about the embassy's security.
